history.heading: Equipment capable of fabricating a metal contact in a vacuum environment by depositing all of the following:
history.title: Equipment capable of fabricating a metal contact in a vacuum environment by depositing all of the following:

supplement.heading: Supplement No. 1 to Part 774 - The Commerce Control List

breadcrumbs: 3B090 Semiconductor manufacturing equipment, not Controlled by 3B001, as follows (see List of Items Controlled) and “specially designed” “parts,” “components,” and “accessories” therefor.
Semiconductor manufacturing deposition equipment, as follows:
history.text:
Equipment capable of fabricating a metal contact in a vacuum environment by depositing all of the following:
A titanium nitride (TiN) or tungsten carbide (WC) layer using an organometallic compound while maintaining the wafer substrate temperature between 20 °C and 500 °C;
a.8.a. A titanium nitride (TiN) or tungsten carbide (WC) layer using an organometallic compound while maintaining the wafer substrate temperature between 20 °C and 500 °C;
A cobalt layer using a physical sputter deposition technique where the process pressure is 1-100 mTorr while maintaining the wafer substrate temperature below 500 °C; and
a.8.b. A cobalt layer using a physical sputter deposition technique where the process pressure is 1-100 mTorr while maintaining the wafer substrate temperature below 500 °C; and
A cobalt layer using an organometallic compound, where the process pressure is 1-100 Torr, and the wafer substrate temperature is maintained between 20 °C and 500 °C.
a.8.c. A cobalt layer using an organometallic compound, where the process pressure is 1-100 Torr, and the wafer substrate temperature is maintained between 20 °C and 500 °C.
